jparsec.ephem

Enum RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT>
      • jparsec.ephem.RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT>
    Enclosing class:
    RiseSetTransit

    public static enum RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT
extends java.lang.Enum<RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT>
    The set of twilights to calculate (types of rise/set events).

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CUSTOM
      ID value for a custom 'rise' and 'set', setting the value for the horizon elevation.
      HORIZON_ASTRONOMICAL
      Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for the local horizon.
      HORIZON_ASTRONOMICAL_34arcmin
      The standard value of 34' for the refraction at the horizon.
      TWILIGHT_ASTRONOMICAL
      Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for astronomical twilight.
      TWILIGHT_CIVIL
      Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for civil twilight.
      TWILIGHT_NAUTICAL
      Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for nautical twilight.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean considerObjectAngularRadius
      Set to false to neglect the angular size of the object when using a custom rise and set calculation.
      double horizonElevation
      Set the minimum elevation above the horizon in radians to consider the rise and set of a given object.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • TWILIGHT_ASTRONOMICAL

        public static final RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT TWILIGHT_ASTRONOMICAL
        Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for astronomical twilight. In this case, the calculated time will be the time when the center of the object is at -18 degrees of geometrical elevation below the astronomical horizon. At this time astronomical observations are possible because the sky is dark enough.

      • TWILIGHT_NAUTICAL

        public static final RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT TWILIGHT_NAUTICAL
        Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for nautical twilight. In this case, the calculated time will be the time when the center of the object is at -12 degrees of geometric elevation below the astronomical horizon.

      • TWILIGHT_CIVIL

        public static final RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT TWILIGHT_CIVIL
        Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for civil twilight. In this case, the calculated time will be the time when the center of the object is at -6 degrees of geometric elevation below the astronomical horizon.

      • HORIZON_ASTRONOMICAL

        public static final RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT HORIZON_ASTRONOMICAL
        Event ID for calculation of rising and setting times for the local horizon. In this case, the calculated time will be the time when the upper edge of the object is at -32.67 arcminutes of geometric elevation (0.0 of apparent elevation) below the horizon, including the effects of the depression of the horizon.

        Note 32.67' is the refraction in the horizon following the Astronomical Almanac 1986, where an algorithm to correct from geometric to apparent elevation is given. Since we use that algorithm, this value is provided here for consistency, instead of different values used by other authors, which are near 34'. In any case, this value depends on the atmospheric conditions, and the difference is below 10s in the time of the events.

      • HORIZON_ASTRONOMICAL_34arcmin

        public static final RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT HORIZON_ASTRONOMICAL_34arcmin
        The standard value of 34' for the refraction at the horizon. This is the value used for calculations in Ephem class. The effects of the depression of the horizon are not considered when using this constant.

      • CUSTOM

        public static final RiseSetTransit.TWILIGHT CUSTOM
        ID value for a custom 'rise' and 'set', setting the value for the horizon elevation.

    • Field Detail

      • horizonElevation

        public double horizonElevation
        Set the minimum elevation above the horizon in radians to consider the rise and set of a given object.

      • considerObjectAngularRadius

        public boolean considerObjectAngularRadius
        Set to false to neglect the angular size of the object when using a custom rise and set calculation. Default value is true.
